instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 2936 logic board - charging slow
threads.message:
Hi,

I have a 820 2936 mb that charges very slowly.
Already changed <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> with a known good one but no change, same thing with U 7000.
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> area look good no water damage.
Any idea where to look next?
Battery at 95 % and the estimated time of full charge is 35minutes.

Thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 2936 logic board - charging slow
threads.message: Diode mode measurement on the gate of <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR>? I hope you tried a known good battery and are using a known good 60W charger.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 2936 logic board - charging slow
threads.message:
Diode mode on gate of <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> 0.641
original Apple  60 W charger  

Bad battery seems like, the one in the macbook has 794 cycles, tried with a 2 cycles one and it shows 1h10 min to charge from 47%

Thanks Duke
